body:
Basically, the issue is that we permit HEAD requests against GETs without an explicit mapping in routes, but the match in `GlobalSettings` isn't exhaustive: https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/2.4.2/framework/src/play/src/main/scala/play/api/GlobalSettings.scala#L119

If you use the new `HttpRequestHandler`, it looks like it will serve a 404 in this case: https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/2.4.2/framework/src/play/src/main/scala/play/api/http/HttpRequestHandler.scala#L128

It would probably make sense to specifically handle `WebSocket` in both cases, and always serve a 400 for a HEAD request on a websocket.
The new `HttpRequestHandler` looks like it will handle this case the same, the code for HEAD handling looks identical to me. But yeah, those are the bits of code I suspect to be the cause here too.

@gpgekko the line I linked shows that anything that isn't `Some(action: EssentialAction)` is mapped to a 404 in `HttpRequestHandler`. In `GlobalSettings` only `None` is mapped to 404, which is why you got a `MatchError`, since there is nothing that matches `Some(WebSocket(...))`

Oh wow, you're right! My apologies, seems I read to quickly. Better test
the code I've written around that time yesterday in case I had more brain
failures, lol.

Met vriendelijke groet,
Guylian Pot

2015-07-28 1:18 GMT+02:00 Greg Methvin notifications@github.com:

> @gpgekko https://github.com/gpgekko the line I linked shows that
> anything that isn't Some(action: EssentialAction) is mapped to a 404. In
> GlobalSettings only None is mapped to 404, which is why you got a
> MatchError, since there is nothing that matches Some(WebSocket(...))
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/4878#issuecomment-125376617
> .
Closing this for now. A up-to-date ticket can be raised against master if it's still reproduced with. Best regards

We see it in production:

issue.title: Is sbt-rjs dead?
issue.body:
Clearly a lot of people use sbt-rjs but why is it not maintained. The build is broken when looking at Travis. Why are not the pull request even looked at? 4 months and no new release on this?

In this post you want people to to try sbt-rjs with sbt 1.4 https://github.com/sbt/sbt-web/issues/118. Sbt-web 1.4.0 and sbt-rjs 1.0.8 does not work together.

Is this project dead?
Do you need help?
#66 #68 #69 #71 #75

@huntc @jroper

body: @alaz can you provide a test case for this please?  A small github project that can repo it will work as well.

@wsargent sure I can.

1. Get a [Play Websocket example](https://github.com/playframework/play-scala-websocket-example)
2. Run it: `sbt ~run`
3. Open another terminal window and invoke `curl -I http://localhost:9000/ws`
4. Voila:

```
$ curl -I http://localhost:9000/ws
HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
Content-Length: 4936
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Date: Tue, 07 Mar 2017 19:58:49 GMT
```

Thanks @alaz. I was able to reproduce the problem following the steps you described. This is still an issue with Play 2.5.12 (the latest stable release).

Reopening.
@marcospereira Is this also happening in the master branch?
